data.title: Finally ate at Glory Bound
data.text: I have heard great things and finally ate there last Thursday night when in town for the game and the wait was long everywhere else. The gyro's were delicious and it was a fun college town place with a great bar and tv's. My food was delicious. My only complaint was the sour smell when we walked in. (sometimes bars with kegs have that and place that have cleaned with a sour mop). When I went downstairs to the restroom it was very very clean smelling and the bathroom was spotless. Fries were greasy but the potatoes were very fresh and the pita for the gyro was outstanding. Great choice.

data.title: Chris in the bar is the man!
data.text: Good food, good food, good food and great drinks!!  Want some, come get some.  The shawarma plate is amazing and the local cocktails satisfy.

data.title: Gyro's and hummus are amazing!
data.text: We've been here a number of times now, and it's even one of our favorite places to take friends and family when they come to town, as the food is always amazing. The hummus trio as an appetizer is always a winner, as are the gyro's for an entree. My favorite is the pesto pepperjack gyro -- and the cocktails are delicious as well! Prices are really good, I definitely recommend trying this place!

data.title: GO Greek!
data.text:
Gyro's are spot on as well as the salads. Go on Tuesday if you are in the mood for a huge salad without a huge $ price.
They have daily specials on both food and drink. Very casual place to get quick service...

data.title: Date Night
data.text: The food was great. The drinks were strong but awesome. We got two apps, the multi humus and the cheese spinach both of which were good. The bloody Mary was the best I've ever had. The peach infused scotch was good but strong. The pepperjack gyros are to die for. Great place would deffinately go back. Would love to try breakfast here.

data.title: Good Food, Great Price!
data.text: Everything that we had was delish!  Lots to choose from. Nice atmosphere.  I loved the greek salad and the guys had the gyros, can't beat them.  Give this a try when you are in downtown Tuscaloosa.

data.title: Dinner for one, with lots of fun!
data.text: Superb food and a great price. The Gyro plate and veggies are fantastic.  $12 dinner that is awesome.  Come get some!

data.title: Good food, good service
data.text: Came into Tuscaloosa from out of town and ate lunch here. Service was friendly and the gyros were delicious. The steak fries weren't very warm, but the sandwich more than made up for it. Would visit again.

data.title: The glory bound specialty Mediterranean
data.text: We were looking for something different!  We were going to mug shots next door.  Saw this was open so decided to try it.  Boy we were glad we did my wife tried a chicken gyros I did Mediterranean plate it was awesome

data.title: Awesome gyro
data.text:
Saw this on TA, Looked at the menu online and decided to check it out, it was an easy walk from the Home2Suite hotel.
Started off with a bloody mary for me, and my wife got their Moji-tea (had to record the ingredients as my wife insisted I should make these for her at home). Both drinks were excellent. Really loved their basic gyro modification with the pepper jack cheese,.it was truly excellent. I also liked my greek salad. My wife liked her meal too, being a lover of hummus and pita. The dessert of pita bits with vanilla ice cream, cinnamon and caramel was surprisingly excellent too. We liked the place enough that we decided to eat our last lunch there as we were headed out of town. My wife got a seafood platter consisting of shrimp and rice, sauteed vegetables and pita with dipping sauces. She liked it. I got another excellent gyro and what was called deluxe hash browns. The hash browns were definitely a disappointment given how great the rest of the food was. It turned out to be some soggy french fries with a smattering of cheese, onions, tomato and bell peppers on it. I ate the topping and left the fries. I told the girl that didn't look like hash browns at all to me, and she apologized for their being different from what one would expect. Oh well. I did love the pepperjack gyro though, makes me wish we had a restaurant of this chain in Gainesville.

data.title: Americanize Greek done well.
data.text: We were in town visiting my son and dropping off my girls for swim camp.  Decided to try the place out since it was Father's Day.  They had craft beers from around Alabama and a few from Georgia and Louisiana.  Good variety too.  The hummus was great but you needed about twice the number of pita slices to be able to eat it the way I was taught.  They did bring more out when I asked.  The family had a wide variety from the menu (all Greek dishes of course).  It was well prepared, well presented and definitely didn't sit heavy on the stomach.  If there was one nit it would be that the floor was sticky in a few places.  It is obviously rented out for sorority or fraternity functions but they try to keep it up.  Just missed a few spots here and there.  Overall, I'm very happy and we'll visit again when back in Tuscaloosa.

data.title: Different food ... but Great taste
data.text: If you like gyros and hummus this is a great place. The gyros taste great and after you try the hummus most love it. The service is good, and it usually is full for lunch and dinner with a mix of business folks and students at lunch and families and students at dinner. Some good deals sometimes like buy one get one gyros on certain days.

data.title: Well done, Very well done
data.text:
Ate her for lunch during a business trip to Tuscaloosa. The menu has a wide variety of salads and gyros and really looks outstanding at first glance. They also have speciality hummus options. 

The service was decent although the it could have been a bit better in spots. Most in our party ordered one of the gyros and the general consensus were they were very good. I ordered the Santorini (the grilled chicken salad) and thought it was excellent. The raspberry vinaigrette dressing was outstanding. Would definitely go back again.

data.title: A sure miss
data.text: Sometimes you wonder why a restaurant fails.  It can be for lots of reasons of course but the quality of the food has to be #1.  A gyro HAS to have wonderful bread.  If not, we're already lost.  Our bread was thick and Chewy.  The meat was find and the sauce lacking.  Come for the drinks.

data.title: Hummus is so good!
data.text: Got some food to go. Between 3 people we split the roasted red pepper hummus, chicken Greek salad and a strak/chicken platter. All of it was very good. I would highly suggest the hummus.

data.title: Disappointing service, wrong amount charged.
data.text: Went on $5 Gyro day. 2 other people with me. I know its busy but it was like pulling teeth to get our drinks refilled. The manager actually filled our drinks once. We ordered 3 $5 gyros, and one to go. When my bill came it was $31. 5x4=20. We all had water. I didn't catch it till I got back to work. When I call and inquired about it, it got UHHHHH and click hung up on. Cross this off the list of places ill be going any  time soon.

data.title: Excellent food!
data.text: The wait was a little long for the food but it was so amazing! Must try the Cajun hummus and steak gyro. The tomato basil soup was really tasty too.

data.title: Great place for Greek Food!
data.text: My husband and I visited this restaurant for the first time at lunch. They have a wide array of gyros with chicken, lamb, beef, and shrimp. I had the Pepper Jack shrimp gyro and my husband ordered the chicken, spinach, pesto gyro. Both of these were delicious! We shared a Greek salad, which was large and freshly prepared. The food, service, and prices were great! We will definitely be back to try some of the other specialties on the menu like the different flavors of hummus that sounded really good!

data.title: Wonderful
data.text: Great spot for lunch with superb specials on Tuesdays and Wednesdays! Very good service from good people.

data.title: Great building, excellent food.
data.text: Their Gyro selections range from traditional lamb to steak, chicken and shrimp.  They do a great job of including all tastes in their offerings.  I had the Shwarma and I loved it.  I've been back a number of times now and it will stay on my favorites list.  It is located downtown where parking can be tricky.  They seem to also have seating available when the other restaurants in the area (Mugshots) are full and waiting.  Full bar with local drafts on tap.
